setupDesc: This is your first run. Please create an admin account.
passwordMin6: Password must be at least 6 characters
firstRunHint: First run detected, please configure your system.

menu.resetConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset the system? This will clear all local configurations.
menu.aboutDesc: All-in-one AI gateway control plane — gateway, agents, sessions, scheduling, security & multi-node, at your fingertips.
menu.whatsappTip: WhatsApp needs no token. Run openclaw channels login after setup to scan QR code.

dash.sessionsEmptyHint: No active sessions. Start a chat to create one
dash.partialData: Some data failed to load; showing available data
dash.fetchFailed: Failed to load data. Please try again.
dash.instancesEmptyHint: No online nodes yet. Start gateway/node and refresh

chat.configMissing: Please configure and activate a gateway first
chat.welcome: Hello! How can I help you?
chat.confirmDeleteSession: Are you sure you want to delete this session? This cannot be undone.
chat.sessionHistoryCleared: This session history was cleared, while usage stats still keep historical totals

agt.confirmSaveMsg: Save changes to {file}? This will overwrite the agent's current file content.

cfg.noDataHint: Connect Gateway and refresh to load configuration.

sk.updateAllDesc: Update all installed ClawHub skills to latest
sk.sentToAgentHint: Sent to agent. Check your chat channel for install progress.
sk.copiedHint: Install info copied. Paste and send it to OpenClaw.
sk.installPromptIntro: Please help me install an OpenClaw skill:
sk.installPromptSteps: Please detect my environment, install the missing dependencies, then verify the skill works.
sk.installPromptMarket: Please help me install a skill from ClawHub market:
sk.installPromptMarketSteps: Please run openclaw skills install {slug} to install this skill, then detect and install missing dependencies, and verify it works.

sch.title: Scheduler
sch.name: Name
sch.selectJob: Select a job to view history
sch.schedulerHelp: Scheduler configures automated tasks for AI agents, supporting interval, one-time, and Cron expression scheduling
sch.noJobsHint: Click 'New Job' to create your first scheduled task
sch.selectJobHint: Click a job card to view run history
sch.noRunsHint: After the job runs, execution records will appear here
sch.scheduleHelp: Every: periodic | At: one-time | Cron: use Cron expression
sch.sessionHelp: Main: use agent's main session | Isolated: use independent session per run
sch.payloadHelp: System Event: trigger system-level event | Agent Turn: send message to agent

act.title: Sessions
act.label: Label
act.selectSession: Select a session to view details
act.subject: Subject
act.activityHelp: Session management for viewing and managing AI agent conversations, including token usage and session settings
act.noSessionsHint: When users chat with AI agents, session records will appear here
act.selectSessionHint: Select a session from the list to view details and message preview
act.overridesHelp: Set AI parameters for this session individually, overriding global config
act.messagesHelp: Recent message preview, showing up to 20 messages

alrt.title: Exec Approvals
alrt.desc: Manage exec approval policies and allowlists
alrt.wsLiveDesc: Approval requests will be pushed in real-time
alrt.securityDesc: Controls which commands AI can execute
alrt.askDesc: When to require human confirmation before execution
alrt.askFallbackDesc: Fallback policy when approval times out or no one responds
alrt.autoAllowSkillsDesc: Auto-approve CLI tools from installed skills without asking
alrt.optAllowlistHint: Only allow commands in the allowlist
alrt.optAskOffHint: Decide by security mode, no approval prompt
alrt.optAskOnMissHint: Prompt when command is not in allowlist
alrt.optAskAlwaysHint: Require human confirmation for every command
alrt.optFallbackAllowlistHint: Only allow allowlisted commands on timeout
alrt.fwdDesc: Forward approval requests to messaging channels for mobile review
alrt.fwdEnabledDesc: When enabled, approval requests are sent to specified channels
alrt.fwdModeSessionHint: Send back to the chat session that triggered the command
alrt.fwdModeTargetsHint: Send to the configured target channels below
alrt.fwdModeBothHint: Send to both session and configured targets
alrt.fwdAgentFilterDesc: Only forward approvals for specific agents, leave empty for all
alrt.fwdSessionFilterDesc: Only forward matching sessions, leave empty for all
alrt.alertsHelp: Approval Center manages human approval workflows for AI command execution, ensuring sensitive operations are authorized
alrt.pendingHelp: When AI requests to execute a command requiring approval, it will wait here for your approval or rejection
alrt.policyHelp: Configure command execution permissions and approval rules for different agents
alrt.notifyHelp: Forward approval requests to messaging channels for convenient mobile review
alrt.allowlistHelp: Commands in the allowlist can be executed directly without approval each time
alrt.approvalStep2: System checks security policy and allowlist
alrt.approvalStep3: If approval needed, pushed to this page or messaging channel
alrt.approvalStep4: After you approve or deny, AI continues execution
alrt.noPendingHint: When AI requests to execute a command requiring approval, it will appear here
alrt.noAgentsHint: Please create an agent in the Agents page first, then configure approval policies for it
alrt.targetFormatHelp: Format: channel:userID, e.g. telegram:123456 or discord:987654321

sec.title: Security Center
sec.scoreDesc: Based on rule coverage and risk mitigation
sec.rulesDesc: Manage built-in and custom detection rules
sec.deleteConfirm: Delete this rule? Built-in rules cannot be deleted.
sec.logsDesc: View alerts triggered by security rules
sec.systemEventDesc: Push a system event to the Gateway for processing

set.usernameTooShort: Username must be at least 3 characters
set.pwdTooShort: Password must be at least 6 characters
set.backupDesc: Backup OpenClaw config files for easy recovery
set.backupSecurityNote: Backup files are automatically sanitized. Tokens, keys, and other sensitive fields are replaced with ***REDACTED***. Please re-enter credentials after restoring.
set.restoreRedactedWarn: This backup contains redacted fields. After restoring, please re-enter your Tokens and keys in the OpenClaw configuration.
set.restoreOkRedacted: Restored. Please re-enter Tokens/keys and other sensitive fields.
set.auditDesc: Track all user operations for security auditing
set.openclawUpdateDesc: Check if a newer version of OpenClaw is available
set.selfUpdateDesc: Check and update ClawDeckX to the latest version
set.selfUpdateNoAsset: No update package available for this platform
set.accessSecurityDesc: Configure network access settings for ClawDeckX. Restart required after changes.
set.corsOriginsHint: Origins allowed for cross-origin access. Empty = same-origin only.
set.accessSaved: Access config saved. Restart required to take effect.
set.restartHint: Browser will reconnect automatically after restart
set.donateLine1: ClawDeckX was born from passion, grown through persistence.
set.donateLine2: Code written in the quiet of night, interfaces shaped with simplicity.
set.donateLine3: If it saves you time and effort,
set.donateLine4: your support is the light that keeps it moving forward.
set.donateThankYou: Open source is hard. Your usage is the greatest support!
set.donateFeedback: Submit bug reports or feature requests
set.aboutIntro:
ClawDeckX is an open-source web control panel built for OpenClaw.
macOS-grade visual experience, guided setup, real-time monitoring, multilingual support, local & remote gateway management.
Transforming complex AI agent management into an elegant, intuitive experience.
set.aboutNote: This is my first open-source project, developed almost entirely with the help of AI. There may be imperfections and bugs. If you find any issues or have suggestions for improvement, feel free to submit an Issue or Pull Request. Thank you for your understanding and guidance — every piece of feedback drives me forward.
set.notifyDesc: Configure external notification channels for alerts. Supports reusing OpenClaw channel tokens.
set.notifyTgTokenHint: Leave empty to reuse the Telegram Bot Token from OpenClaw config
set.notifyTgChatIdHint: Enter the Telegram user or group Chat ID to receive notifications
set.notifyDdTokenHint: The access_token from DingTalk group bot Webhook URL
set.notifyDdSecretHint: Signing secret (starts with SEC). Leave empty to skip signing.
set.notifyLarkUrlHint: Custom bot Webhook URL from Lark/Feishu
set.notifyDcTokenHint: Leave empty to reuse the Discord Bot Token from OpenClaw config
set.notifyDcChannelIdHint: Discord channel ID to receive notifications
set.notifySlackTokenHint: Leave empty to reuse the Slack Bot Token from OpenClaw config
set.notifyWebhookTemplateHint: Use {message} as placeholder. Leave empty for plain text.
set.notifyNoChannels: Please configure at least one notification channel first
set.notifyReuseHint: Detected Telegram in OpenClaw config. You can reuse the Bot Token — just enter a Chat ID.

fileApply.title: Confirm Apply
fileApply.affectedFiles: The following files will be modified
fileApply.backupHint: Backup files are visible in the Agent file list for recovery
fileApply.selectAtLeastOne: Please select at least one file

maint.title: Maintenance
maint.subtitle: System diagnostics, session cleanup, context optimization, token tracking
maint.sessDesc: Scan and clean orphan sessions to free storage
maint.ctxDesc: Analyze workspace file token usage and optimize context budget
maint.tokDesc: Track token usage and costs, set budget alerts

scenario.title: Scenarios
scenario.subtitle: Choose a scenario and configure with one click
scenario.author: Author
scenario.combiningTipDesc: You can combine multiple scenarios! For example, apply both "Personal Assistant" and "Email Manager" scenarios. Each scenario appends content to workspace files (like SOUL.md, HEARTBEAT.md) without overwriting existing content, giving your Agent multiple capabilities.

multiAgent.title: Multi-Agent
multiAgent.subtitle: Deploy multi-agent collaboration workflows for complex automation
multiAgent.author: Author
multiAgent.fullDeployHint: Create independent subagents that can be called by the main agent
multiAgent.quickSetupHint: Add workflow capabilities to the current agent, enabling it to call subagents
multiAgent.quickSetupExists: This workflow already exists, configuration will be updated
multiAgent.quickSetupConfirmDesc: This will add the following capabilities to the current agent:
multiAgent.quickSetupAbility1: Know available subagents and their responsibilities
multiAgent.quickSetupAbility2: Learn to use sessions_spawn tool to call subagents
multiAgent.quickSetupNote: After enhancement, the agent can intelligently delegate tasks to appropriate subagents
multiAgent.deployModeEnhanceDesc: Add workflow capabilities to the current agent, enabling it to call subagents. Best for quick start and single-agent scenarios.
multiAgent.deployModeDeployDesc: Create multiple independent subagents that can be called by the main agent. Best for complex tasks requiring specialized roles.
multiAgent.nextStepsDesc: Subagents have been created and the main agent has been configured. Now you can:
multiAgent.nextStep1: Send tasks to the main agent, it will automatically call appropriate subagents
multiAgent.nextStep2: Use /subagents list command to check subagent running status
multiAgent.nextStep3: Use /subagents send <number> <message> to send messages to a specific subagent
multiAgent.nextStepsTip: 💡 Tip: The main agent has learned how to use the sessions_spawn tool to call subagents
multiAgent.collaborationTipDesc: Choose "Enhance Agent" to teach the main agent how to call subagents, or "Deploy Subagents" to create independent specialized agents. After deployment, the main agent will automatically use sessions_spawn to call appropriate subagents.

workflow.taskPlaceholder: Describe the task for this workflow...
workflow.deployFirst: Please deploy subagents first using the "Deploy Subagents" button before running the workflow.

multiAgentDeploy.title: Deploy Multi-Agent System
multiAgentDeploy.previewDesc: This will create multiple independent AI Agents, each with their own workspace and configuration.
multiAgentDeploy.prefixHint: Agents will be named: prefix-agentId (e.g., my-team-researcher)
multiAgentDeploy.coordinatorUpdatedDesc: SOUL.md has been updated with subagent orchestration info
multiAgentDeploy.coordinatorNotUpdatedDesc: Please manually configure the main agent
